titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Napoleon Jackson Tecumseh Dana Papers, 1882-1886
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: The collection consists of a draft of a statement by Dana regarding the record of R.C. Hutchinson, a secret agent for the Federal army; letters to Dana concerning a court case against the U.S. government concerning household items confiscated by Dana's family from the home of Mrs. E.P. Malloy of Memphis, Tennessee.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Napoleon Jackson Tecumseh Dana Papers, 1882-1886, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Napoleon Jackson Tecumseh Dana (1822-1905) was soldier in the U.S. Army, and resident of New York, NY.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a draft of a statement by Dana regarding the record of R.C. Hutchinson, a secret agent for the Federal army; letters to Dana concerning a court case against the U.S. government concerning household items confiscated by Dana's family from the home of Mrs. E.P. Malloy of Memphis, Tennessee.
